description.raw:
The method implemented does the following:

 - Check for glxinfo application
 - If found, run it and grep GLEW_EXT_Framebuffer_object symbol (see issue #318, 2º comment for details)
 - If not found, try to run a python (pyopengl) helper script
 - If no pyopengl is installed, the script will throw an exception catched by cmake and return false in the VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.

If runned both, glxinfo or gl-test.py script, and the DISPLAY variable is not present (imaging a system without X enviroment), it will return false in VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.

  • If found, run it and grep GLEW_EXT_Framebuffer_object symbol (see issue #318, 2º comment for details)
  • If not found, try to run a python (pyopengl) helper script
  • If no pyopengl is installed, the script will throw an exception catched by cmake and return false in the VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.

If runned both, glxinfo or gl-test.py script, and the DISPLAY variable is not present (imaging a system without X enviroment), it will return false in VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.

title.raw: Check for DRI capable display in cmake
